text: Arthur Gore (1891–1969) was an Australian rugby league footballer who played in the 1920s for St. George. A local junior from the Arncliffe Waratahs,THE PROPELLER (Hurstville) "Juniors" Arthur Gore reference https://trove.nla.gov.au/newspaper/article/234938536?searchTerm=%22arthur%20gore%22%20%22st.george%22&searchLimits;=l-state=New+South+Wales|||l-decade=192 Gore was graded in 1922 and played two seasons during the foundation years of the St. George. He was a handy hooker who held his position in the team until his retirement in 1923, age 32.The Encyclopedia of Rugby League Players by Whiticker/Hudson (1995 Edition). Gore died on 15 April 1969 at Kogarah, New South Wales.Sydney Morning Herals- Death Notice 17/4/1969 ==References== Category:St. George Dragons players Category:Australian rugby league players Category:Rugby league players from Sydney Category:Rugby league hookers Category:1891 births Category:1969 deaths
title: Arthur Gore (rugby league)
